La ceremonia tendrá lugar en el estadio David Haffner el 30 de julio a las 7:30 p.m. La decisión de avanzar con nuestro plan se tomó después de consultar con los funcionarios del departamento de salud local y el personal de personal de emergencias de la ciudad. We WILL NOT release school early today. I’ve communicated with Chief Dagnan and Sheriff Kaiser throughout the day regarding their officers’ experiences today. There were a few spin-offs early when the freezing drizzle and dropping temperatures occurred. However, since that time, there have been very few issues regarding slick road conditions. I did receive a report regarding a few roads in eastern Jasper County and a few bridges were a little slick. City workers are salting the roads, especially around school areas.

As you head home, you will be surprised if you have not been outside lately as you will have to scrape ice off your windows!

I will drive the roads in the morning determining whether the road conditions warrant school cancellation. However, as of right now, WE WILL HAVE school tomorrow.

One thing I do know is it will be cold. Please bundle up and dress warm. Please contact us if you know someone needing winter clothing. We have partnerships with many generous community members willing to help our children.

Thanks.

Mark

Inclement weather update . . .

It is hard to believe I am sending this information prior to Halloween!!

Please remember if I must cancel school due to inclement weather, I will do so in multiple formats: Facebook post, robo call to specific phone numbers listed in our student information system, announcement on our district website (www.carthagetigers.org), and on local television and radio stations. The perfect scenario is to notify you the night before. However, reality necessitates the decision will usually be made the next morning. I will always attempt to make the decision prior to 6:00 am. Unfortunately, southwest Missouri weather sometimes forces me to delay the decision.

Thanks.

Mark
